message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.ST, cs.DS

Reasoning: The paper deals with empirical risk minimization and class probability estimation, which are common topics in machine learning and statistics. The focus on binary classification also suggests a connection to computer vision and pattern recognition. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The use of proper scoring rules and excess risk bounds suggests a connection to statistical theory, which makes cs.ST (Statistics Theory) a likely sub-category as well. Finally, the use of different surrogate loss functions suggests a connection to optimization and algorithms, which makes cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) a possible sub-category.
